resources.string: The board consists of 9 regular tic tac toe boards, called sections.
To win a section, you must be the first player to claim 3 boxes in a straight line.
To win the game, one player needs to win 3 sections in a straight line.
In this example, Player O wins with 3 sections in a diagonal line from the top left to the bottom right.
In this complex example, Player X wins with 3 sections in a line at the bottom of the game board.
The section highlighted in red shows what section the next move will be played in.
The blue highlighted section helps the player enlarge a section.
If the highlighted red and highlighted blue are in the section, it will be pink.
The most recent move by the previous player will be green.
For example, player O chose the top right box of the middle section. Player X can now choose any box in the top right section.
Player X chose the bottom center box of the top right box. Player O may now choose any box in the bottom center section.
Player O chose the top left box of the bottom center section. Player X may now choose any box in the top left section.
The section each player plays in matches the position of the box chosen by the previous player.
If all of the boxes in one section are claimed, the current player may choose any unclaimed box on the whole board.
